result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher R Barber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher R Barber is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher R Barber was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Christopher R Barber was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher R Barber

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek postconviction relief; none of the boxes marked
Minutes emailed to DOC

Court reporter Lynn Schultz. Defendant Christopher R Barber in court.  Attorney Gregory n Dutch in court for Christopher R Barber.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 2 and 3.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #1.

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #2       
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve 4 months in the DCJ, with Huber; cc to count 3

-Stayed for 2 years probation cc to 3- Court does give permission for the DE to transfer probation in the State of Indiana

COUNT #3      
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve 4 months in the DCJ, with Huber; cc to count 2

-Stayed for 2 years probation cc to 2-Court does give permission for the DE to transfer probation in the State of Indiana

CONDITIONS:
-DNA on file

-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
-Early termination after 18 months with agent approval

-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #2 and 3
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due on probation

-Days credit if revoked: 4 days

DE advised of post-conviction rights

[Jaime D.]
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Christopher R Barber appeared by phone.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Request by Atty Dutch for his client to appear by phone for arraignment.**THIS REQUEST IS APPROVED. ATTY DUTCH TO PROVIDE A PHONE NUMBER TO THE COURT**
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Arraignment on August 12, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Payments of $50/month to commence 6/24/22 for repayment of attorney fees.
Attorney Greg Dutch appointed
Contacted defendant advised he was approved for court appointed attorney and explained how to proceed.
Appeal of Eligibility Determination for Appoint of Counsel
Collections clerk left voicemail advising CDP application denied and to contact collections to here options on how to appeal
Defendant not eligible for court appointed counsel through Dane County - income over established guideline.
initial application denied

- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

02:21 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Guy Cardamone.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
